net.sf.wubiq.data

Class RemoteClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.wubiq.data.RemoteClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @Entity
public class RemoteClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains the remote info and status. Each connected client is represented by an instance of this class.
    Author:
    Federico Alcantara
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getClientVersion() 
      java.lang.String getComputerName() 
      long getConnectionFailures()
      Deprecated. 
      Connection failure is no longer maintained. This method will always return 0. The number of times a client connection had failed. When a client connection is dropped more than 20 seconds it is a considered a connection failure and added up.
      java.lang.Long getInactiveTime()
      Deprecated. 
      Not used anymore.
      java.util.Date getLastAccessed() 
      java.lang.Long getLastAccessedTime()
      Deprecated. 
      Use getLastAccessed
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getServices()
      Deprecated. 
      No use. Services are handled by RemotePrintServiceLookup
      java.lang.String getUniqueId() 
      java.lang.Boolean isKilled() 
      java.lang.Boolean isPaused()
      Remote client pause state.
      java.lang.Boolean isRefreshed() 
      boolean isRemoteActive()
      Deprecated. 
      Control of its active state is transferred to the Remote Client Manager. Determines if the remote is active and working.
      boolean isRemoteDead()
      Deprecated. 
      No longer used for determining the state of the client. Clients are ALWAYS considered connected, to definitively kill a client a 'kill' command must be issued either by the client or by the server. The state is handled by the RemoteClientManager.
      void setClientVersion(java.lang.String clientVersion) 
      void setComputerName(java.lang.String computerName) 
      void setInactiveTime(java.lang.Long inactiveTime)
      Deprecated. 
      Never used.

      void setLastAccessed(java.util.Date lastAccessed) 
      void setLastAccessedTime(java.lang.Long lastAccessedTime)
      Deprecated. 
      Use setLastAccessed instead.
      void setPaused(java.lang.Boolean paused)
      It is recommended to pause the remote client through the RemoteClientManager provided interface.
      void setRefreshed(java.lang.Boolean refreshed) 
      void setServices(java.util.List<java.lang.String> services)
      Deprecated. 
      Services are not registered here. They are registered at RemotePrintServiceLookup.
      void setUniqueId(java.lang.String uniqueId)

      • isRemoteActive

        public boolean isRemoteActive()
        Deprecated. Control of its active state is transferred to the Remote Client Manager. Determines if the remote is active and working.
        Returns:
        Always returns true.

      • isRemoteDead

        public boolean isRemoteDead()
        Deprecated. No longer used for determining the state of the client. Clients are ALWAYS considered connected, to definitively kill a client a 'kill' command must be issued either by the client or by the server. The state is handled by the RemoteClientManager.
        Determines if the remote is dead for a long time.
        Returns:
        Always returns true, meaning that the client is not dead.

      • isPaused

        public java.lang.Boolean isPaused()
        Remote client pause state.
        Returns:
        Current pause state of the remote client.

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(java.lang.Boolean paused)
        It is recommended to pause the remote client through the RemoteClientManager provided interface.
        Parameters:
        paused -

        public java.lang.String getClientVersion()

        the clientVersion

      • setClientVersion

        public void setClientVersion(java.lang.String clientVersion)
        Parameters:
        clientVersion - the clientVersion to set

      • getConnectionFailures

        public long getConnectionFailures()
        Deprecated. Connection failure is no longer maintained. This method will always return 0. The number of times a client connection had failed. When a client connection is dropped more than 20 seconds it is a considered a connection failure and added up.
        Returns:
        The number of times the connection failed.
